long_description: The GLM2Predict function uses the model and (optionally) the regularization table output by the GLM2 function to perform generalized linear model prediction on new input data.

input_tables.name: input
input_tables.rDescription: Table containing the test data set.
input_tables.description: Table containing the test data set.

input_tables.name: model
input_tables.rDescription: The table which contains the model table generated by the GLM function.
input_tables.description: The table which contains the model table generated by the GLM function.

input_tables.name: regularization
input_tables.rDescription: The table which contains the regularization table generated by the GLM function.
input_tables.description: The table which contains the regularization table generated by the GLM function.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of input table columns to copy to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specify the names of input table columns to copy to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: Lambda
argument_clauses.rDescription: If you specify a regularization table, otherwise disallowed. Specifies which lambda values in the regularization table to use to make predictions. If you omit the regularization table and Lambda argument, the function uses the minLambda value from the model table. (In the model table, minLambda appears in the level column.) If you specify the regularization table but omit the Lambda argument, the function uses all lambda values in the regularization table. If the Lambda argument specifies a lambda value that is not in the regularization table, the function uses the lambda value in the regularization table that is closest to the value that you specified.
argument_clauses.description: [Optional if you specify a regularization table, disallowed otherwise] Specify which lambda values in the regularization table to use to make predictions. If you omit the regularization table and Lambda argument, the function uses the minLambda value from the model table. (In the model table, minLambda appears in the level column.) If you specify the regularization table but omit the Lambda argument, the function uses all lambda values in the regularization table. If the Lambda argument specifies a lambda value that is not in the regularization table, the function uses the lambda value in the regularization table that is closest to the value that you specified.

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
